text: The Ygyatta ()Словарь названий гидрографических объектов России и других стран — членов СНГ, Federal Service for Geodesy and Cartography of Russia, 1999, p. 448 is river in Sakha, Russia. It is a left tributary of the Vilyuy. The Ygyatta is long, and its basin covers about . The depth of the river at its mouth is near . It rises on the Vilyuy Plateau in the west of Sakha and is fed by rain and snowmelt.Ыгыатта, Great Soviet Encyclopedia The river and its banks are rich with gems: emeralds, rubies, sards, aquamarines, and others. There are goldfields along the river. The basin of the Ygyatta is among the least populated places within Russia. ==See also== *List of rivers of Russia ==References== ==External links== * Ygyatta from space Category:Rivers of the Sakha Republic
title: Ygyatta
